repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Fixes neovim/nvim-lspconfig#3788  
Simpler version of previous PR (#33949)

The most common use-case would be enabling server from [nvim-lspconifg](https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig) for all filetypes by just setting:
```lua
    filetypes = { '*' },
```
as a simpler way in contrast to defining `merge_behavior` function (#33833) or other alternative discussed in #33577.

comment_regular_data.body: Can we not just use an empty (resolved) `filetype` entry for that?

> Can we not just use an empty (resolved) `filetype` entry for that?

Users already have `"*"` in their configs from the legacy nvim-lspconfig API.

And for readability, I'd say empty table suggests client being enabled for no filetypes.

But not enabled can be done by -- wait for it -- just not enabling the server. So this is free real estate. 

(And to be blunt, I don't care about the legacy nvim-lspconfig API; the only thing that matters here is the Neovim API that we will have to maintain for years to come. So this is the chance to pick one that works best _for us_.)

> as a simpler way in contrast to defining `merge_behavior` function (#33833) or other alternative discussed in #33577.

I don't see how this PR solves these problems.

> Can we not just use an empty (resolved) `filetype` entry for that?

Exactly. Why add another method for something we already support?

> But not enabled can be done by -- wait for it -- just not enabling the server. So this is free real estate.
>
> (And to be blunt, I don't care about the legacy nvim-lspconfig API; the only thing that matters here is the Neovim API that we will have to maintain for years to come. So this is the chance to pick one that works best for us.)

I didn't say that setting `filetypes = {}` should be for disabling. I pointed it's less readable if used for meaning of "enable for all", while `"*"` is more direct and consistent with other places (legacy API, `vim.lsp.config("*", {...`, `autocmd FileType * ...`).

> > as a simpler way in contrast to defining `merge_behavior` function (#33833) or other alternative discussed in #33577.
> 
> I don't see how this PR solves these problems.

Setting `filetypes = { '*' }` is significantly simpler than defining any function that will remove a field from the config, and prevent somehow its re-addition.

> Exactly. Why add another method for something we already support?

What? Currently setting `filetypes = {}` effectively disables the server
That is not what I wrote, for the record (`{} ~= nil`).

> That is not what I wrote, for the record (`{} ~= nil`).

Wait, you meant setting `filetypes` to `nil`?  
Inability to set it to that "value" is the clou of the problem.
(neovim/nvim-lspconfig#3788)
Yes, which is why there are ALREADY open issues and PRs to allow that.

> Yes, which is why there are ALREADY open issues and PRs to allow that.

Yes, but they are significantly more complicated, and performance heavy, while setting `"*"` is very straightforward, easy, and consistent with other options.
Yes, but it also addresses _a lot_ more use cases, so it's much higher leverage. Again, the concerns in Neovim core are very different from those in downstream plugins (including nvim-lspconfig).

> Yes, but it also addresses _a lot_ more use cases, so it's much higher leverage. Again, the concerns in Neovim core are very different from those in downstream plugins (including nvim-lspconfig).

But this is not replacement for `merge_behavior` function in `vim.lsp.config()` - this should happen regardless.

The `*` is but a simple sigil to mark that given server is to be launched for all filetypes. Heck, it even simplifies creation of `merge_behavior` function for the end user, because they don't need to maintain separate table that will tell whether lack of `filetypes` field is deliberate or not.

In other words:

 * `filetypes` is `nil` - **fallback** to "enable for all"
 * `filetypes = {'*'}` - **conscious** choice by the user to "enable for all"
There need not and should not be two different ways for doing the same thing, and that's the last I'll say on this.

> There need not and should not be two different ways for doing the same thing, and that's the last I'll say on this.

Well, that requires but simple re-framing :-)

@Jorenar for a moment I was very close to approving [these changes](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/e1c9da50f66a35346493bd187146f8c6a1f06fc8), as they're just a way of making "explicitly clear" that a certain LSP server is to be applied to _all_ filetypes, and I sincerely understood your argument.

But then I re-read @clason's comments, and as someone that has contributed to nvim's core I also agree that this isn't a desired change. As part of our ongoing effort of porting `nvim-lspconfig` into core is making sure that we don't make the same mistakes, and having multiple ways to achieve a certain behavior is both a pain to maintain and confusing to document.
Eh, in that case can I hope for an answer to the question https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/33833#issuecomment-2869173369?

title: feat(lsp): filetypes table containing "*" enables server for all
